comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: In 1912 [the Australian prison ship, Success, turned museum ] crossed the Atlantic and spent more than two decades doing the same thing around the eastern seaboard of the United States of America and later in ports on the Great Lakes. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Success_(prison_ship)

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: If you look again, it seems that it is just the back of the bench that might appear to be lodged in the cannon.

comment.author: 90719112@N00
comment._content: Interestingly enough, this cannon was up for sale on Ebay a few years ago! If want to learn in more detail about, and see many more photos of this extraordinary vessel, check out my website and blog. I have researched this ship for over 40 years. Rich Norgard www.shipsuccess.com www.shipsuccess.blogspot.com
